p: It is noteworthy that both aspen and black poplar buds contained no or trace amounts of benzoic acid. In our opinion, high amount of this component in propolis may be the result of degradation of some volatile and non-volatile benzyl derivates. Some data [ 17, 18, 19, 20, 21] suggest that bees preferentially collect exudates from vegetative poplar buds which are rich in benzyl derivates (as they inhibit Populus buds cracking and maturation into leaves). Benzoic acid is a known food preservative and it may be possible that bees in the northern hemisphere have a preference towards exudates degradation which results in the presence of this component in propolis.
